intro: Psoralea azuroides, commonly known as the pink psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pink or purple flowers. The plant produces trifoliate leaves and has a taproot system that allows it to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
